> <OLD>
>
> Tucson keeps firing as he continues to back up Vestige with all=
 his dedication. He finds that physical fire isn't much good against the in=
sects but when he did excercise spiritual power, it seemed to help Vestige =
and himself immensely. He thinks for a moment and looks to Vestige.
>
> "Ve=
stige, our power lies in something that these insects do not have. Our hear=
ts. The simplest power of all, one that all living creatures are capable of=
 expressing, and the one ability that these creatures do not possess. We mu=
st use that power now if we're going to vanquish our enemy and get Rodimus =
back. it will unite all three of us, and only then, can we defeat this foe.=
"
>
> His chest now pulsating as it had before, with the force of a beating=
 heart filled with compassionate power. Several plates on his chest shift, =
as a well protected heart like structure beats luminously. He looks to Vest=
ige.
>
> " Our compassion for each other, our loyalty to our comrades, our =
love for our fellow Autobots. That is the one power that can never be extin=
guished. You believe in that power, reach down, touch it, and allow yoursel=
f to allow it to flow freely within you. It will light all flames as it has=
 for centuries. We can do this Vestige, we can do this. For Rodimus Prime, =
our hearts are with him, as his is with us. Let's unite them and end this o=
nce and for all."

<NEW>

Vestige was, like Tuscon, firing to keep off thes=
e undoubteldy much
stronger insectoid creatures. Laser beams and miniature =
missiles were
flying throuygh the air in an effort to keep the creatures at=
 bay.

Meanwhile the creatures continued to approach, doing thier best to
p=
ush through hail of weapons fire that came from the beleagered
Autobots, ho=
wever they did not appear to be faring well under the
onslaught from Tuscon=
 and Vestige!

However it was at this time that the door behind crashed ope=
n and
several blue and white winged flying insectoids were flying in, thier=

stinger flashing in the light from this room!

"I get it now!" Vestige sai=
d as he turned to see thier new threat, "We
must unite!" he said as if unde=
rstanding the import of Tuscon's,
although not quite in the way that he mea=
nt them. Turning back to fire
a few shots at the new threat of flying Insec=
toids he glanced at
Tuscon, "I need to get to that bed!" He said talking ab=
out the bed the
insecoids had been working over and the figure that now lay=
 prone on
it.
